dialogues.text: Why would you say that? * She looks at him. *

dialogues.speaker: MADYLYN
dialogues.text: Because it's as good a story as any. * He stares at her dumbstruck. The sirens and lights of * approaching fire trucks crest the hill behind him. * Madylyn stares back. * The house is engulfed in flames - the kitchen, the furniture, the T.V., the porch - all of it burns. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack’s Retirement Party: Jack's co-workers - WARDEN, Dickerson, Janice, Peterson, and as twenty others cheer and clap. Jack smiles uncomfortably under a GOOD LUCK ON THE OUTSIDE banner.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: He's free! He's free! No sign of Madylyn. TIMECUT: Jack having drinks and accepting congratulations from colleagues. There’s a muted awareness that it’s been tough time for him and people are trying to be cheery.

dialogues.speaker: DICKERSON
dialogues.text: (drunk, laughing it up) You won't have me to kick around any more! Better get a dog!

dialogues.speaker: SOME GUY
dialogues.text: {laughing} That's what wives are for! Uncomfortable glances all around. Jack shrugs it off with small laugh. TIMECUT: Jack’s at a table with Janice. They're huddled u sharing war stories and advice and he’s making her laugh. appreciates his advice and it seems cozy. He’s definitely too much but he still seems to be keeping it together.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: but do not..f mean reall DO NOT make it a two-way conversation. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They got nothing but time to think about how to work on you...get under your skin. You can’t make yourself a person with them.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Oh believe me... learned that lesson.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: They'll test you for sure... {looks at her) Good looking woman like you... He smiles. He puts his hand on her knee out of sight of anybody else. Janice takes it in and looks at him nicely.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: (soft) Jack...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (grins) I’m retired, not dead you know.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: C'mon, we're friends, you're the best...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: A little fun...send me off into the sunset... He leans in a little. She’s uncomfortable but she’s tryin be cool.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Uh uh...let’s keep it pro, okay? He stares at her a long time. She can’t tell if he’s depressed or just going to nod and drop it. But he keeps staring at her and it gets dark. He starts talking very l so only she can hear. From a distance nobody could tell t weren’t just chatting.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Want to be a pro? Fuck you, pro. They're going to chew you alive in there,

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Jack -

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (low and hard) No no...jerk my chain like that. Fucking cunt. Have some respect... Janice 1s shocked almost to tears. Warden arrives with da plays it cool.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: C'mon buddy, let‘s take these kids On... Janice stands and so does Jack. He’s still staring like a cobra at Janice but she’s trying to make it easy...

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m in... Jack leans toward her aggressive...we see how drunk he actually is.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Up yours... Warden grabs him back

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa buddy...all good fun... Jack actually resists for a second then shrugs it off. Immediately embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (slurring) Sorry...not your fault. He holds out his hand to Janice JACK (CONT‘D) Hey...Not your fault. I'm all fucked...- I should go. Everybody's feeling bad for him.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: Ride with me.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No no, I’m good. He sways a little.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m good. I'll get a cab. They all look uncomfortable. JACK (CONT’D) Word of honor. Cab. EXT. BAR/RESTAURANT -— NIGHT 156 Jack exits, stumbling a little. He gets in his car and fi it up. EXT./INT. STREET/JACK’S CAR - NIGHT 157 Jack drives. Focused on something. Simmering. EXT. LUCETTA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 158 Jack sits in his car. Waiting and watching. The door open and STONE emerges. He walks off down the dark street. Jac opens the glove box and takes out his GUN, gets out of th car and follows him on foot. TIGHT ON: Stone - as he looks up and double takes. STONE‘S POV: Jack is blocking his path. They stare at each other a long time. Still. Jack approaches. He's clearly off balance but he's boring into Stone with his eyes. He pulls his hand out of his jacket pocket, showing the edge of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadowy. One high light in an adjacent parking lot throwi pool of light into the alley. Jack and Stone come along t back wall of the market. Jack stops him against a wall ju on the edge of lights. A STREET LIGHT IS BUZZING OVERHEAD...

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: dack, what‘s...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's face tight with rage. Stone is oddly calm, observi him, not fighting.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: {drunk} What’d you do? Stone looks quizzical. JACK (CONT’D) Why did you do this? Stone just smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think I won't! THE BUZZ OF THAT LINE IS TURNING INTO A DRONE, VIBRATING. Stone's eyes seem to widen a little. JACK COCKS THE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You think I won't! Jack bores into him, demanding that he accept the blame f it all. But Stone just stares at him and shakes his head tiniest bit. Jack threatens with the gun, bullying...but biuff has been called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STONE eases out of his grasp and walks away. He doesn’t e look back. He just walks out of the pool of light and int the shadow and disappears around the corner. THE SOUND is loud...humming. Jack is alone with himself, nobody else to blame. Jack HOWLS, looks at the gun... WE CUT TO BLACK AND THE SOUND STOPS. 160 EXT. CANDACE’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - DAY 160 BRIGHT SUN. A BEE buzzing around brings us to... CANDACE 40’ish, with her father’s black hair, is putting sunscreen on a little girl, 4 years old, who is protestin

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I know sweetie. But it’s the sunburns you get now that give you the cancer later.
MADYLYN, watching. Gives her daughter a look of admonitio

dialogues.speaker: MADYLYN
dialogues.text: Who knew? We didn’t know. If we'd known, of course we would have...done differently. Madylyn takes a drag from her cigarette and turns the pag looking at the photo album. Candace lets Katie go.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: You're greased. Katie jumps up and down in a kiddie pool. Candace joins her mother under the umbrella, taking a dra from her mother’s cigarette and giving it back to her. She peers down at the photo album

dialogues.speaker: MADYLYN
dialogues.text: {re the photos) Cut-glass lamps.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Where is that?

dialogues.speaker: MADYLYN
dialogues.text: Place we used to rent at the beach. You don’t remember it? You loved playing in the water with your father.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I love that shag carpet. A long beat as they watch Katie.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t know how you stuck it out as long as you did. I can’t believe you didn’t dco this sooner.

dialogues.speaker: MADYLYN
dialogues.text: I almost did. Once.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: What happened? Madylyn doesn't answer. Just smokes.

dialogues.speaker: MADYLYN
dialogues.text: You have a limited point of view. It got better. Gentler.
Candace looks at her mother. Madylyn stares off into the middle distance.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: MADYLYN
dialogues.text: I hope he’s eating. Candace groans and gets up to go inside.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I’m monitoring your calls. She leaves her mother. Madylyn stares and thinks. The faint SOUND OF A BEE starts rising.... AND WE HEAR A MAN’S VOICE BEGIN TO SPEAK. Inarticulate an strange, struggling to find the words...the voice runs ov the following scenes,

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: i ain’t know...how can I know? INT. LUCETTA’S APARTMENT ~ SUNDAY MORNING i161 Stone is packing a small duffel bag. No Lucetta.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ain’t nobody come into this place and want to stay the same. That I know for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stone with duffel bag, looking around A POWER LINE IS HUMMING, merging with that SOUND FROM THE BEE, growing subtly... MAN’S VOICE (V.0.) Do I deserve to be free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucetta in a bar. Bartender brings a drink and points to guy down the bar. He nods at Lucetta. She gives her siren smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164 165 166 168 There's a neon bar sign BUZZING.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Up to me I say I do. I want to be. I hope to he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack arrives at the complex he’s made into his life. Ente the outside. Walking down a hall with a cardboard box in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But I don’t know... INT. PRISON ~ JANICE’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 165 Over the shoulder of JANICE, we see an INMATE, discussing himself and we see that this is the man who has been talk in VOICE OVER. In the open door behind him, Jack crosses with the box... pauses only slightly to look in on the Inmate speaking th moves on.

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: I don’t know who get to make that decision you know... INT. PRISON - JACK’S OFFICE ~ CONTINUOUS 166 Entering he sets the box on his desk and surveys everythi that made up his life. And then he starts to box it up. EXT. CANDACE‘’S BACKYARD - SUNDAY MORNING 167 Madylyn sits staring, smoking and thinking. The BUZZING LOUDER NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucetta sits naked on the edge of a bed. A man's body out focus behind her. She's happily painting her toenails and smoking. Takes a drag and stares into space. The SOUND rising...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird light. Getting out into the empty spaces beyond a city. But not beautiful. Neutral, uncertain. STONE is walking along the road under power lines humming Unreadable. Impossible to tell where he's going or what h doing. The Sound now powerfully vibrating... INT. PRISON - JACK’S OFFICE ~ CONTINUOUS 170 Wide on Jack behind his desk with a box on it, room strip bare and empty. Jack's life is dismantled and packed up i boxes. There is one last picture frame on the desk. We ca see what it is. He picks it up and packs it up, looking d into the box. He stands there, head down, lost in thought The SOUND is LOUDER NOW, CLEARER. VIBRATING. Almost unconsciously Jack turns his head, towards the sou Just barely.
